channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge holes in pathway, 28th June
item.description:
Outside the main block of Bissextile House and Crescent House. Since the council have resurfaced the Pathway (to extend the road). It has become dusty and full of holes. Tenants were originally told the path would be returffed, there would be more trees, flowers planted unfortunately there are none and its become full of dusty holes, and trip hazards. I am concerned that someone will fall and hurt themselves
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bliss Crescent, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaking bags of cement dumped on street., 28th June
item.description:
2 badly leaking bags of white cement have been dumped on the street outside our house at 185 Glyn Road E5OJS. It’s going all over the road and into a nearby bike hangar. Please clear up asap!!!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Inver Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Parking on crossing, 28th June
item.description:
The same commercial vehicles are repeatedly parking on the pavement and on the zigzag lines of the zebra crossing. As many as 3 vehicles parked simultaneously on the same section. This is an endorsable offence and needs to be enforced. Pedestrians have been run down on this crossing in the past.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Church Hill Road, East Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dunsmure Road N16 Needs Cleaning, 28th June
item.description:
The entire street top to bottom needs cleaning on Dunsmure, especially the south side. Every week loads of rubbish and litter is strewn up and down the street. It is worse on recycling days. Can you please have someone clean weekly as it’s a constant mess

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunsmure Road, Hackney, London
